008 *******************************************************************************/
009package imagingbook.common.geometry.ellipse;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
012import static java.lang.Math.PI;
013import static java.lang.Math.cos;
014import static java.lang.Math.sin;
015import static java.lang.Math.sqrt;
016
017import java.awt.Shape;
018import java.awt.geom.AffineTransform;
019import java.awt.geom.Ellipse2D;
020import java.awt.geom.Path2D;
021import java.util.Locale;
022
023import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
024import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Primitive2d;
025import imagingbook.common.geometry.ellipse.project.OrthogonalEllipseProjector;
026import imagingbook.common.geometry.shape.ShapeProducer;
027import imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic;
028
029/**
030 * <p>
031 * Represents an ellipse with major axis length ra, minor axis length rb, center
032 * point (xc, yc), and orientation theta. Instances are immutable. See Secs.
033 * 11.2.2 and F.3.1 for details.
034 * </p>
035 * <p>
036 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
037 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
038 * </p>
039 * 
040 * @author WB
041 * @version 2022/11/17
042 */
043public class GeometricEllipse implements ShapeProducer, Primitive2d {
044        
045        /**
046         * Ellipse parameters.
047         */
048        public final double ra, rb, xc, yc, theta;
049        private final OrthogonalEllipseProjector projector;
050        
051        /**
052         * Constructor.
053         * Axis lengths may be exchanged to ensure ra &ge; rb.
054         * 
055         * @param ra major axis length
056         * @param rb minor axis length
057         * @param xc center point (x)
058         * @param yc center point (y)
059         * @param theta orientation
060         */
061        public GeometricEllipse(double ra, double rb, double xc, double yc, double theta) {
062                this.xc = xc;
063                this.yc = yc;
064                if (ra >= rb) { // make sure ra is always the longer axis!
065                        this.ra = ra;
066                        this.rb = rb;
067                        this.theta = Arithmetic.mod(theta, PI); // theta = 0,...,pi always
068                }
069                else {
070                        this.ra = rb; // swap ra/rb
071                        this.rb = ra;
072                        this.theta = Arithmetic.mod(theta + PI/2, PI);  // theta = 0,...,pi always
073                }
074                this.projector = new OrthogonalEllipseProjector(this);
075                
076                if (this.ra < this.rb) {
077                        throw new RuntimeException(this.toString());
078                }
079        }
080        
081        /**
082         * Constructor, short version for axis-aligned ellipses.
083         * Axis lengths may be exchanged to ensure ra &ge; rb.
084         * 
085         * @param ra major axis length
086         * @param rb minor axis length
087         * @param xc center point (x)
088         * @param yc center point (y)
089         */
090        public GeometricEllipse(double ra, double rb, double xc, double yc) {
091                this(ra, rb, xc, yc, 0.0);
092        }
093        
094        /**
095         * Constructor.
096         * @param p parameter vector [ra, rb, xc, yc, theta].
097         * @see #getParameters()
098         */
099        public GeometricEllipse(double[] p) {
100                this(p[0], p[1], p[2], p[3], p[4]);
101        }
102        
103        /**
104         * Constructor.
105         * Creates a new {@link GeometricEllipse} from a {@link AlgebraicEllipse} instance.
106         * @param ae a {@link AlgebraicEllipse} instance
107         */
108        public GeometricEllipse(AlgebraicEllipse ae) {
109                this(getGeometricEllipseParameters(ae));
110        }
111
112        /**
113         * Calculates and returns the geometric ellipse parameters from a
114         * given algebraic ellipse (see Eqns. 19-23 at 
115         * <a href="http://mathworld.wolfram.com/Ellipse.html">http://mathworld.wolfram.com/Ellipse.html</a>).
116         * 
117         * @param ae a {@linkplain AlgebraicEllipse} instance with parameters (A,...,F)
118         * @return the geometric ellipse parameters (ra, rb, xc, yc, theta)
119         * @see AlgebraicEllipse
120         */
121        public static double[] getGeometricEllipseParameters(AlgebraicEllipse ae) {
122                // see Eq. 19-23 at http://mathworld.wolfram.com/Ellipse.html
123                double[] params = ae.getParameters(); 
124                final double A = params[0]; // ae.A;
125                final double B = params[1]; // ae.B;
126                final double C = params[2]; // ae.C;
127                final double D = params[3]; // ae.D;
128                final double E = params[4]; // ae.E;
129                final double F = params[5]; // ae.F;            
130                final double d = sqr(B) - 4*A*C;
131                
132                if (d >= 0) {
133                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("B^2 - 4AC must be negative for an ellipse");
134                }
135
136                final double q = sqrt(sqr(A-C) + sqr(B));
137                final double s = 2*(A*sqr(E) + C*sqr(D) + F*sqr(B) - B*D*E - 4*A*C*F);
138                
139                double xc = (2 * C * D - B * E) / d;
140                double yc = (2 * A * E - B * D) / d;
141                double ra = sqrt(s / (d * (-A - C + q)));
142                double rb = sqrt(s / (d * (-A - C - q)));
143                double theta = 0.5 * Math.atan2(-B, C - A); // theta = -pi/2,...,+pi/2
144                
145                return (ra >= rb) ? // make sure ra >= rb (ra is the major axis)
146                        new double[] {ra, rb, xc, yc, theta} :
147                        new double[] {rb, ra, xc, yc, theta + PI/2} ;
148        }
149        
150        // ---------------------------------------
151
152        /**
153         * Returns a vector of parameters for this ellipse. The length of the vector and
154         * the meaning of the parameters depends on the concrete ellipse type.
155         * 
156         * @return a vector of parameters [ra, rb, xc, yc, theta]
157         */
158        public double[] getParameters() {
159                return new double[] {ra, rb, xc, yc, theta};
160        }
161        
162        public Pnt2d getCenter() {
163                return Pnt2d.from(xc, yc);
164        }
165        
166        public double getArea() {
167                return this.ra * this.rb * Math.PI;
168        }
169        
170        public double getAlgebraicDistance(Pnt2d p) {
171                return new AlgebraicEllipse(this).getAlgebraicDistance(p);
172        }
173        
174        /**
175         * Returns the ellipse point closest to the specified point.
176         * To perform this calculation for multiple points on the
177         * same ellipse use {@link OrthogonalEllipseProjector}.
178         * 
179         * @see OrthogonalEllipseProjector
180         * @param pnt some 2D point
181         * @return the closest ("contact") point on the ellipse
182         */
183        public Pnt2d getClosestPoint(Pnt2d pnt) {
184                return projector.project(pnt);
185        }
186        
187        public double[] getClosestPoint(double[] pnt) {
188                return projector.project(pnt);
189        }
190        
191        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
192
193    /**
194         * Returns the mean squared error between this ellipse 
195         * and a set of 2D points.
196         *
197         * @param points a set of sample points (usually the points used for fitting)
198         * @return the mean squared error
199         */
200        public double getMeanSquareError(Pnt2d[] points) {
201                double sum2 = 0;
202                for (Pnt2d p : points) {
203                        sum2 = sum2 + p.distanceSq(getClosestPoint(p));
204                }
205                return sum2 / points.length;
206        }
207        
208        /**
209         * Returns the closest (geometric) distance of the specified point to this ellipse.
210         * @param p some 2D point
211         * @return the distance to the closest point on the ellipse
212         */
213        @Override
214        public double getDistance(Pnt2d p) {
215                return p.distance(getClosestPoint(p));
216        }
217        
218        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
219        
220        @Override
221        public Shape getShape(double scale) {
222                return this.getOuterShape();
223        }
224        
225        @Override
226        public Shape[] getShapes(double scale) {
227                return new Shape[] {
228                                getOuterShape(),
229                                getCenterShape(scale),
230                                getAxisShape()
231                };
232        }
233        
234        private Shape getOuterShape() {
235                Ellipse2D oval = new Ellipse2D.Double(-ra, -rb, 2 * ra, 2 * rb);
236                AffineTransform trans = new AffineTransform();
237                trans.translate(xc, yc);
238                trans.rotate(theta);
239                return trans.createTransformedShape(oval);
240        }
241        
242        private Shape getCenterShape(double radius) {
243                double dxa = 2 * radius * cos(theta);   // major axis is drawn longer
244                double dya = 2 * radius * sin(theta);
245                double dxb = 1 * radius * cos(theta + PI/2);
246                double dyb = 1 * radius * sin(theta + PI/2);
247                Path2D path = new Path2D.Double();
248                path.moveTo(xc - dxa, yc - dya);
249                path.lineTo(xc + dxa, yc + dya);
250                path.moveTo(xc - dxb, yc - dyb);
251                path.lineTo(xc + dxb, yc + dyb);
252                return path;
253        }
254        
255        private Shape getAxisShape() {
256                double dxa = ra * cos(theta);
257                double dya = ra * sin(theta);
258                double dxb = rb * cos(theta + PI/2);
259                double dyb = rb * sin(theta + PI/2);
260                Path2D path = new Path2D.Double();
261                path.moveTo(xc - dxa, yc - dya);
262                path.lineTo(xc + dxa, yc + dya);
263                path.moveTo(xc - dxb, yc - dyb);
264                path.lineTo(xc + dxb, yc + dyb);
265                return path;
266        }
267        
268        @Deprecated             // used for book figures only
269        public Pnt2d getLeftAxisPoint() {
270                return Pnt2d.from(xc - ra * cos(theta), yc - ra * sin(theta));
271        }
272        
273        // -------------------------------
274        
275        public GeometricEllipse duplicate() {
276                return new GeometricEllipse(this.getParameters());
277        }
278        
279        @Override
280        public boolean equals(Object other) {
281                if (this == other) {
282                        return true;
283                }
284                if (!(other instanceof GeometricEllipse)) {
285            return false;
286        }
287                return this.equals((GeometricEllipse) other, Arithmetic.EPSILON_DOUBLE);
288        }
289        
290        public boolean equals(GeometricEllipse other, double tolerance) {
291                return 
292                                Arithmetic.equals(xc, other.xc, tolerance) &&
293                                Arithmetic.equals(yc, other.yc, tolerance) &&
294                                Arithmetic.equals(ra, other.ra, tolerance) &&
295                                Arithmetic.equals(rb, other.rb, tolerance) &&
296                                Arithmetic.equals(Math.cos(theta), Math.cos(other.theta), tolerance) &&
297                                Arithmetic.equals(Math.sin(theta), Math.sin(other.theta), tolerance) ;
298        }
299        
300        @Override
301        public String toString() {
302                return String.format(Locale.US, "%s [ra=%.8f, rb=%.8f, xc=%.8f, yc=%.8f, theta=%.8f]", 
303                                this.getClass().getSimpleName(), ra, rb, xc, yc, theta);
304        }
305
306}
